questions.question: Are the three large arched windows on the upper level of the building present and arranged symmetrically?
questions.explanation: In Image B, observe the top level of the building: there are three large arched windows present. They are visually identical in design and symmetrically arranged across the facade. This arrangement reflects typical architectural symmetry in buildings, contributing to aesthetic balance.

questions.question: Is the tall vertical black sign positioned at the center top of the building?
questions.explanation: In Image B, a tall vertical black sign is visible at the center top of the building, protruding upwards. Such placement is standard for central signage on commercial buildings, providing visibility and identification.

questions.question: Does the building retain the decorative cornice with spire-like finials along the roofline?
questions.explanation: In Image B, along the roofline, the building has a decorative cornice with detailed finials that resemble spire-like shapes. These elements typically serve decorative purposes in architecture, adding stylistic detail to the roof edges.

questions.question: Are the Walgreens and Marina Theater signs located on the left and right sides of the ground floor respectively, with red script lettering?
questions.explanation: In Image B, on the ground floor, the signs for Walgreens on the left and Marina Theater on the right are visible. They have red script lettering, which stands out against the lighter background, ensuring brand visibility. Red is often chosen for signage due to its attention-catching nature.

questions.question: Are the two vintage cars positioned in front of the Walgreens and Marina Theater entrances respectively?
questions.explanation: In Image B, two vehicles resembling vintage cars are positioned in front of the building. One car is located directly outside the Walgreens entrance on the left, and another car outside the Marina Theater entrance on the right. This placement suggests their parked positions relative to the entrances.

questions.question: Are there people visible near the entrances of the Walgreens and Marina Theater?
questions.explanation: In Image B, people can be seen near the entrances of Walgreens and Marina Theater. Their presence suggests pedestrian activity, which is common near commercial establishments, contributing to the dynamic street scene.

questions.question: Is there a sidewalk and curb line in front of the building?
questions.explanation: In Image B, a sidewalk and curb line are evident in front of the building, as indicated by the horizontal lines demarcating street and pedestrian areas. Such elements are typical in urban settings to facilitate pedestrian traffic alongside vehicular roads.
